definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Decreased overall still in channels, short-short pattern is unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 总体仍处于下跌通道中，短期空头格局不变。

sentences.english: A short seller bets that a stock price will fall.
sentences.chinese: 有一个空头押注该公司股票价格将下跌。

sentences.english: To offer a loaf of bread is more useful than making an empty promise.
sentences.chinese: 拿出一个面包比开一张空头支票更有用。

sentences.english: In reality, short-selling is far from being financial black magic.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，空头并非金融巫婆。

sentences.english: None of these restrictions impose a really onerous burden on short-sellers.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些限制，实际都没给空头施加太重的负担。

sentences.english: When both indicators fall together, they show that bears are crushing the market.
sentences.chinese: 当2个指标同时下跌，它表明空头在砸盘。

sentences.english: From Zheng cotton high low open view of the situation, short is more dominant.
sentences.chinese: 而从郑棉高开低走的态势来看，空头更占优势。

sentences.english: IT IS difficult being a short-seller.
We needed her help but were fobbed off by promises.
sentences.chinese: 我们很需要她的帮助，但她用空头支票忽悠了我们。

sentences.english: When both fall, bears are in control and the bar is red.
sentences.chinese: 当两个指标下跌时，空头在主导，竹线是红色的。

sentences.english: We’d agree that the idea of reuse was oversold and oversimplified.
sentences.chinese: 我们同意，重用的想法是空头支票，并且过度简化了。

sentences.english: Your empty promises are lost on the skeptical consumer.
sentences.chinese: 你的空头许诺对于多疑的客户来说毫无用途。
这一不对称性是空头的一大障碍。

sentences.english: As bear raids can be self-validating, they ought to be kept under control.
sentences.chinese: 由于空头袭击可以自我验证，它们应处于控制之下。

definition: many-headed/many-layered (authority)/devolved (as opposed to centralized)/pluralistic/(as classifier) number of animals/long term (finance)/long (investment)
bull market (prices appear to be rising)
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
moving average index (used in financial analysis)
market price/quotation of market price/the current market situation
to continue to fall (of share prices)
to shake up/to jolt/to vibrate/to oscillate/to fluctuate
to regurgitate/(fig.) (of a stock market) to give up (gains)
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
